Job Description -Title: Adabas Linux Database Administrator
Duration: 6+ months
Location: This is a Hybrid role working in Quincy, MA. Candidates MUST be local from one of the following States: MA, RI, CT or NH. All submittals must include ID proof of residency of one of these States.

POSITION OVERVIEW: MA21 seeks a highly motivated Adabas Linux Database Administrator (DBA) who will support a “Lift and Shift” of the on-premises legacy mainframe application to AWS Cloud. The DBA will play an integral role in supporting the cloud rehosting project, maintenance enhancements that may be implemented on the cloud platform, or defect fixes that need to be remediated on the cloud platform to meet the requirements of the business community. The first step in porting operations and systems to a new infrastructure will be to rehost the Natural/Adabas MA21 mainframe system in the AWS cloud.

DETAILED LIST OF JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Monitor and maintain the stability of Adabas/Natural applications supporting services in the Cloud-based, distributed Linus server environment.
Experience supporting Linux operating systems: RedHat (preferred), SuSe, and CentOS. Understanding of Linux operating systems architecture and use of commands and utilities.
Fundamental Cloud knowledge, AWS, Azure.
Responsible for supporting a broad range of Software AG (SAG) and other third-party vendor products to provide a stable technical infrastructure.
Design and implement Adabas databases to ensure optimal performance and scalability.
Participate with database support and provide timely resolution of database-related issues.
Understanding knowledge of EntireX Communicator (RPC & ACI Protocol).
Monitor database performance using tools like Adabas Manager.
Develop and implement backup and recovery procedures using Adabas Backup and Recovery Tools.
Optimize database performance through query optimization, indexing, and buffer pool management.
Monitor database using Adabas Performance Monitor to identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
Administering the Natural development environment.
Experience with Adabas Utilities: Use of utilities like ADAREP, ADABAS, ADASAV, ADAORD, etc. for database maintenance and reporting.
Security certificate configuration with Software AG products.
Upgrades, Configuration, and Management Of Software AG Products on Linux, Including: Upgrades, Configuration, and Management Of Software AG Products on Linux, Including: Adabas EntireX Communicator, Adabas Encryption Natural Construct, ConnX Natural One, Entire Net-Work Natural Security, Entire Connection, Predict, Linux shell scripting, Performing database startup and shutdown. Performing and restoring database backups, Performing Adabas File Reorders, Using the Software AG Update Manager to apply updates/fixes, Using administration subsystems, including cron, to schedule system tasks.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Demonstrated proficiency in business modeling, process modeling, and data modeling.
Knowledge of methods and techniques of computer systems analysis, design, technical terminology, codes, and standard abbreviations.
Using the available system management tools (both console and Web-based System Management).
Knowledge of MA HIX or other State Health Exchange.
Ability to work with multiple vendors.
Proficiency in Microsoft 365, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, and Visio.
Experience with Jira Software.
